newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: Abidjan bourse bull run eases.
newsitem.headline: Abidjan bourse bull run eases.

text.p: A seven-week bull run on the Abidjan Stock Exchange (BVA) showed signs of easing in the week to Friday, with the all-share index falling, its market report showed.
The All-Share Index fell 0.58 percent to 392.26 points, trimming the 1997 rise to 9.63 percent.
The 12 VB blue-chip index did better, rising 0.28 percent to 271.72 points, extending the rise for the year to 12.29 percent.
Tobacco firm SITAB (-4,070 CFA francs to 38,300 CFA) led fallers.
Electricity company CIE (+1,700 to 18,360) and sack maker FILTISAC (+1,550 to 48,500) led risers.

Turnover in cash terms was up on the previous week with shares worth 421,900,900 CFA changing hands compared to 155,536,000 CFA. Slightly more shares changed hands -- 8,924 compared to 8,320 the previous week.
Bourse officials said offers exceeded bids. Details were not immediately available.
